original:
In Oregon, businesses engaged in restoration projects are predominantly small, family-owned enterprises, as defined by the Small Business Administration. These businesses often experience significant seasonal fluctuations in available work. 

The characteristics of these businesses vary based on their customer base. Companies that contract with non-federal clients, such as watershed councils, typically focus on equipment-based work and
